executive summary.company synopsis: Founded in 1956 and headquartered in Eighty Four, Pennsylvania, 84 Lumber Co. is the nation's largest privately held supplier of building materials, manufactured components, and industry-leading services for single and multifamily residences and commercial buildings. The company operates over 320 facilities, including stores, component manufacturing plants, custom door shops, and engineered wood product centers across 34 states. 84 Lumber also offers turnkey installation services for various products, including framing, insulation, siding, windows, roofing, decking, and drywall. A certified national women's business enterprise owned by Maggie Hardy, 84 Lumber has been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Largest Private Companies and has appeared on the Inc. 5000 list of America's Fastest-Growing Companies.

customer engagement suite.elevator pitch:
84 Lumber's rapid expansion to 320+ facilities across 33 states creates unprecedented customer service complexity. With building material inquiries becoming increasingly technical and your $6.3B revenue growth attracting diverse customer segments, traditional support channels may struggle to maintain the personalized service that built your reputation.

As you scale into multifamily markets and western expansion, can your current customer engagement infrastructure handle multilingual support and complex product consultations without compromising the trusted relationships that differentiate 84 Lumber?

Google's Customer Engagement Suite could streamline your omnichannel support with AI-powered virtual agents supporting 100+ languages. Marks & Spencer deflected 50% of calls within 60 days using our Dialogflow CX. Let's explore how this could support your ambitious growth plans.
customer engagement suite.key insights:
- 84 Lumber's expansion to 320+ facilities across 33 states creates customer service complexity with technical building material inquiries. Dialogflow CX virtual agents handle routine product questions in 100+ languages, deflecting calls automatically.

- Managing consistent service quality across diverse contractor and DIY customers while scaling operations becomes challenging. Quality AI provides 100% automated quality assurance versus traditional 5% manual sampling for real-time insights.

- Peak construction season spikes and seasonal demand fluctuations strain customer support capacity across multiple locations. Elastic CCaaS pay-per-use seats scale automatically without fixed licensing costs during variable demand periods.

- Complex product specifications and installation guidance require longer agent interactions, impacting efficiency. Agent Assist provides live transcription and Gemini-powered summaries, reducing average handle time by 30-45% for faster resolutions.

detailed account intelligence.company description:
Founded in 1956 and headquartered in Eighty Four, Pennsylvania, 84 Lumber Co. is the nation's largest privately held supplier of building materials, manufactured components, and industry-leading services for single and multifamily residences and commercial buildings. The company operates over 320 facilities, including stores, component manufacturing plants, custom door shops, and engineered wood product centers across 34 states. 84 Lumber also offers turnkey installation services for various products, including framing, insulation, siding, windows, roofing, decking, and drywall. A certified national women's business enterprise owned by Maggie Hardy, 84 Lumber has been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Largest Private Companies and has appeared on the Inc. 5000 list of America's Fastest-Growing Companies.

84 Lumber offers a comprehensive range of building materials and services, including lumber, decking, doors, drywall, roofing, cabinets, moulding, windows, stairs, railings, siding, insulation, and engineered wood products. The company also provides specialty products such as erosion control solutions, disaster relief products, and tiny houses. Additionally, 84 Lumber offers services like installation, kitchen and bath design, and support for government agencies, international builders, and national builders.
detailed account intelligence.firmographics:
- Company name: 84 Lumber

- Country: United States of America

- Industry: Building Materials and Supplies Distribution

- NAICS code: 423310

- Employee range: 5,001-10,000

- Turnover/Revenue range: $6.3B-$9B

- Company website: https://www.84lumber.com

- Target Segment: 84 Lumber serves both B2B and B2C customers. The company provides building materials and services to building professionals, commercial contractors, home builders, remodelers, developers, and do-it-yourselfers.

business indicators.market development:
- Expanded California presence from 3 locations to 8 locations, with two additional facilities in La Mirada and Lancaster currently in the permitting process.

- Finalized deal to purchase assets from West Coast Lumber, integrating the team into 84 Lumber's Bakersfield and Riverside locations.

- Expanded to new locations in Greeley and Denver, Colorado; Boise, Idaho; Columbus, Ohio; and Indianapolis, Indiana.

- Relocated Western Team Headquarters from Phoenix to Dallas in April 2024, aimed at enhancing company support for stores and improving operational coordination.

- Established 15 multifamily hubs across key markets, with plans to expand further in Texas, Denver, and the Gulf Coast.

- Expanding beyond single-family housing into the multifamily sector, with projects including apartment complexes, hotels, and townhomes.
business indicators.manufacturing and facility expansion:
- Invested $13.4 million in a new component plant in Clarendon County, South Carolina, creating 78 new jobs.

- Established a floor and roof truss manufacturing facility in Manning, South Carolina, serving coastal Carolina markets including Savannah, Charleston, Myrtle Beach, and surrounding areas.

- Opened new component plants in Winter Haven, Florida; Columbia, South Carolina; Boise, Idaho; and a second plant in Atlanta, Georgia.

- Increased component plant capabilities from 4 to 21 plants by end of 2024.

- Planning new truss plant in Bakersfield and truss plant expansion in Yuma, Arizona.

- Opened new facilities in Atlanta, Georgia; Winter Haven, Florida; and a new door shop in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
business indicators.strategic partnerships and acquisitions:
- Named West Fraser as 2024 Vendor of the Year, recognizing their critical supply chain partnership based on sales growth and commitment to service.

- Established strategic partnership with The Home Builders Institute to open cross-selling opportunities.

- Partnered with Home Builders Institute (HBI), sponsoring eight $5,000 scholarships for BuildStrong Academy students in 2025.

- Partnered with Society of American Foresters (SAF) and Alaska Geographic for U.S. Capitol Christmas Tree initiative.
business indicators.technology and innovation:
- Investigating investments in emerging technologies including AI, Machine Learning, IoT, Blockchain, and cloud-based enterprise applications.

- Creating a new Strategic Initiatives department to analyze and bring new products and service initiatives to market.

- Focusing on increasing productivity through information technology systems and processes to provide operational flexibility.

- Showcasing offsite manufacturing techniques with rapid home construction methods, demonstrating efficiency and sustainability.
business indicators.product and service development:
- Expanded product selection to include cedar boards, posts, and James Hardie products catering to the remodeler business.

- Supplying structural framing components, windows, and doors for the 2024 HUD Innovative Housing Showcase.

- Continuing to offer turnkey installation services for framing, insulation, siding, windows, roofing, decking, and drywall.

- Operates 320 facilities across 34 states, including stores, component manufacturing plants, custom door shops, and engineered wood product centers.

technology initiatives.ai and ml initiatives:
- Implemented predictive maintenance using AI software with vibration sensors to detect early signs of motor bearing failure, enabling proactive maintenance and preventing potential production disruptions in 2024.

- Deployed AI-enabled decision-making systems to improve accuracy in log management, lumber production, dimension and species identification, sorting, waste reduction, kiln drying, grading, and planing in 2024.

- Introduced AI-powered worker safety monitoring to detect safety gear compliance and worker fatigue when operating heavy machinery in 2024.

- Implemented AI camera systems to monitor production in dangerous environments, detect problems, and enable autonomous problem-solving in 2024.
technology initiatives.digital transformation:
- Exploring investments in emerging technologies including AI, Machine Learning, IoT, Blockchain, and cloud-based enterprise applications with revenues growing to $8.80 billion in 2024.

- Operates 320 facilities including stores, component manufacturing plants, custom door shops, and engineered wood product centers across 33 states in 2024.

- Recognized as one of the Most Trustworthy Companies in America and one of America's Top Retailers in 2024.
technology initiatives.mobile app development:
- Launched 84LumberLink, the company's communication app in 2024.

- 84LumberLink features include company news push notifications, career opportunity exploration, and industry insights and business prospects in 2024.

- Implemented app performance improvements, bug fixes, and new features in 2024.

- Supports multiple platforms including iOS 15.0+, iPadOS 15.0+, macOS 12.0+, and visionOS 1.0+ in 2024.

- Maintained 84 Lumber Store Locator app with location search and store contact capabilities in 2024.
technology initiatives.employee training & upskilling:
- Operates an onsite training facility booked 50 out of 52 weeks a year, putting several thousand employees through training, with a learning management solution supporting thousands of training hours in 2024.

- Implemented Manager Trainee position as an entry point with opportunities to explore multiple career paths including Store Management, Operations, Outside Sales, Install, and Team Headquarters roles, creating a flexible career lattice approach in 2024.

- 95% of store leadership team starts as manager trainees, with potential to manage their own store in three years for employees willing to learn, work hard, and commit to self-improvement in 2024.

- Exploring innovative training approaches, including AI-assisted code documentation and converting legacy programming languages (CBASIC) to modern languages like Java and Python in 2024.

- Supports veteran employment through Operation Appreciation initiative and National Hire a Veteran Day recruitment efforts in 2024.
technology initiatives.technology stack and infrastructure:
- Revenues grown to $8.80 billion in 2024, with intentions to invest in emerging technologies such as AI, Machine Learning, IoT, Blockchain, and cloud-based enterprise applications.

- Investing in cutting-edge technology as part of facility expansions.
technology initiatives.green it initiatives:
- Focusing on environmentally-driven solutions that reduce carbon footprint, protect ecosystems, and support workers and communities in 2024.

- Selling Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood with a Chain of Custody Certification ensuring rigorous standards from raw materials through distribution in 2024.

- Implementing eco-friendly practices including using renewable resources for lumber, recycling wood and other materials, and promoting energy-efficient building practices in 2024.

- Offering FSC-certified products that can be used to earn points in green building programs like LEED and NAHB in 2024.

competitors.abc supply:
ABC Supply is 84 Lumber's biggest rival, headquartered in Beloit, Wisconsin. Operating in the Construction Supplies & Fittings space, they generate 231% the revenue of 84 Lumber.

**Key Points of Differentiation**

- Significantly larger revenue and market presence

- Established presence in construction supply market
competitors.builders firstsource:
A public company founded in 1998 in Irving, Texas, they are a supplier and manufacturer of building materials, components, and construction services to professional homebuilders, subcontractors, remodelers, and consumers.

**Key Points of Differentiation**

- Publicly traded company

- Broad range of manufacturing and construction services
competitors.carter lumber:
A lumber supplier with over 90 years of history, Carter Lumber has grown to more than 165 locations across the eastern United States. They strive to be the best, not the biggest, focusing on exceptional customer service.

**Key Points of Differentiation**

- Extensive regional presence in eastern United States

- Strong emphasis on customer-centric approach
competitors.mccoy's building supply:
A regional, family-owned building materials retailer operating for over 95 years, with over 80 locations in Texas, New Mexico, and Oklahoma. They serve do-it-yourselfers, farmers, ranchers, and contractors.

**Key Points of Differentiation**

- Focused on regional markets with diverse product offerings

- Strong farm and ranch equipment supply

industry trends.building information modeling (bim) tech: BIM is a promising construction technology that goes beyond traditional 3D modeling, incorporating advanced data analytics and real-time collaboration tools. This shift promises enhanced project coordination, reduced errors, and improved overall project efficiency. Its capabilities are being further enhanced by 3D printing, augmented reality technology, and improved cloud-based sharing and communication.
industry trends.sustainability and green building: Sustainability has become a vital component of the construction industry. Companies are adopting eco-friendly practices, incorporating green building materials and implementing energy-efficient technologies to reduce their environmental footprint. This is increasingly seen as a strategic business imperative. This includes innovations like engineered timber products made by combining softwoods, which can replace steel and concrete, resulting in fewer emissions and less waste during manufacturing.
industry trends.drone and ai technology: Advances in technologies such as drones, AI, and augmented reality have revolutionized construction project management, enabling contractors to enhance jobsite visibility, improve risk management, and open doors to new opportunities. The integration of artificial intelligence is transforming the sector, with AI algorithms optimizing project scheduling, resource allocation, and risk management. Drones and sensors are being utilized for site surveys and monitoring, providing real-time data to improve project visibility.
industry trends.prefabrication and modular construction: Off-site construction fundamentally changes how buildings are created, shifting much of the construction work to controlled factory environments. This approach eliminates weather delays, leads to smoother and faster project completion, and allows for strict quality control. The method results in better-built, more durable structures. This trend is particularly timely given the current shortage of workers in the construction industry, as it helps lower labor costs by reducing the amount of manual labor needed on-site.

customer engagement suite.detailed reasoning: 84 Lumber fails to meet core CES ICP criteria. As a building materials supplier with $6.3-9B revenue and 5,000-10,000 employees, they lack the ≥100 agents or ≥2M annual interactions threshold. Their tech stack shows minimal cloud spend ($3K Azure), no existing contact center solutions, and basic CX tools (Salesforce CRM, Insightly). The company operates 320+ physical facilities focused on lumber/construction materials rather than customer service operations. While they have sufficient revenue scale, their business model centers on B2B building supply distribution, not customer support intensive operations that would benefit from CES capabilities.
customer engagement suite.factors increasing the score:
- Revenue of $6.3-9B meets the ≥$500M threshold for enterprise customers

- Large employee base (5,000-10,000) indicates operational scale

- Uses Salesforce CRM showing some CX technology adoption

- Multi-state operations (34 states, 320 facilities) suggests potential for distributed support needs

- Growth initiatives including facility expansion and technology investments
customer engagement suite.factors decreasing the score:
- Business model focused on physical building materials distribution, not customer service intensive

- No evidence of large-scale contact center operations or agent workforce

- Minimal cloud spending ($3K Azure) indicates limited technology investment appetite

- Tech stack lacks existing contact center or CCaaS solutions

- No mention of customer service pain points, wait times, or containment issues

- Physical retail/distribution model doesn't align with high-volume customer interaction requirements
customer engagement suite.potential next steps:
- Qualify actual customer service operation size and interaction volumes

- Explore any plans for customer service digital transformation initiatives

- Assess potential for virtual agents in order processing or basic customer inquiries

it decision maker.talking points:
• Your aggressive expansion into multifamily construction markets across 15 hubs nationwide means handling complex project inquiries around the clock. Dialogflow CX virtual agents can provide instant quotes and material specifications in multiple languages, deflecting up to 50% of routine calls so your sales teams focus on closing those $6.3 billion revenue opportunities.

• With 5,600 employees across 320 facilities, maintaining consistent customer service quality is challenging. Agent Assist provides real-time transcription and smart reply suggestions during calls, helping your team resolve lumber specifications and delivery questions up to 90 seconds faster, just like Best Buy achieved in their retail operations.

• Your California expansion from 3 to 8 locations creates training bottlenecks for new associates handling technical product questions. Quality AI automatically scores call performance and identifies coaching opportunities, ensuring consistent service delivery as you scale operations without overwhelming your management team.

• Managing peak construction season spikes while maintaining your reputation as one of America's Most Trustworthy Companies requires elastic support capacity. Google's pay-per-use model scales with your seasonal demand fluctuations, eliminating the need to staff for peak periods year-round while maintaining service levels.

• Your component manufacturing plants and door shops generate complex custom orders requiring detailed follow-up. Conversational Insights automatically clusters trending topics like "truss specifications" or "delivery delays," giving your operations team same-day visibility into emerging issues before they impact customer satisfaction.

• With medium cloud spending and existing Microsoft infrastructure, seamless integration is crucial for your digital transformation. Google CES connects directly with your Microsoft 365 and Azure environment through built-in connectors, preserving your current workflow investments while enhancing customer interactions.

• Your Forest Stewardship Council certification and sustainability focus create unique customer inquiries about environmentally-driven solutions. Gen-AI powered chatbots can instantly provide detailed FSC documentation and sustainable product alternatives, positioning your environmental leadership as a competitive advantage in every customer interaction.
it decision maker.probing questions:
• Given your expansion to 320+ facilities across 33 states and recent multifamily market growth, how are you currently managing customer service consistency and communication workflows across your diverse locations, and what challenges do you face during peak construction seasons?

• With your significant technology investments in AI, Machine Learning, and IoT initiatives planned for 2024, how do you envision transforming your customer experience operations to better serve both contractors and DIY customers across your expanding footprint?

• As you've grown to over $6.3 billion in revenue with 5,600+ employees, what pain points are you experiencing with customer inquiry resolution times, order status communications, and technical support across your stores, component plants, and installation services?

• Considering your recent California expansion and West Coast integration efforts, how are you planning to scale your customer support capabilities to maintain service quality while managing multilingual customer needs and varying regional requirements?

• Are you currently using any cloud-based contact center or customer service platforms to manage inquiries across your 320+ facilities, or are you primarily relying on traditional phone systems and in-store support?

• On a scale of 1-5, how would you rate your current ability to automatically handle routine customer inquiries like order status, product availability, and basic installation questions without requiring human agent intervention?

• Do you have real-time visibility into customer service performance metrics and quality assurance across all your locations, or is this currently managed through manual processes and periodic reviews?

• Workforce leads eliminate after-hours staffing gaps by deploying 24/7 virtual agents that handle order status checks and material availability questions, ensuring your professional customers get instant answers even when your physical locations are closed.

• Operations managers boost first-call resolution when Agent Assist surfaces relevant product recommendations and installation guidance during live calls, helping your team quickly match contractors with the right materials and reducing costly callback volumes.
it influencer.probing questions:
• How are your contact center agents currently handling the mix of contractor questions, DIY customer inquiries, and store location requests - are they jumping between multiple systems to find product availability, pricing, and installation service details?

• When customers call about complex building projects or custom orders, how much time do your agents spend after each call typing up notes and coordinating follow-ups between your stores, component plants, and installation teams?

• With 320+ locations across 33 states, how are you managing quality assurance across all your customer interactions - are supervisors able to review enough calls to catch training opportunities or service issues before they escalate?

• During peak construction season or when you're launching in new markets like your recent California expansion, how quickly can you scale up your contact center capacity without overwhelming your existing team structure?

• When Spanish-speaking customers or contractors call your locations in markets with diverse populations, how seamless is the handoff process, and do agents have real-time translation support during those conversations?

• Given your growth from $6.3 billion revenue and ongoing expansion into multifamily construction, how are you tracking customer sentiment and identifying recurring questions that could be automated to free up agents for more complex project consultations?

• With your current mix of Microsoft 365, Salesforce, and various operational systems, do your contact center agents have a unified view of customer information, or are they toggling between different screens to access order history, store inventory, and service requests?

customer engagement suite.the google advantage:
• Unlike traditional contact centers requiring months of setup, Google's Customer Engagement Suite delivers Agent Assist in just 10 days and full virtual agents under 90 days, with pay-per-use pricing that autoscaled Bell Canada to 10,000 agents while saving $20M quarterly.

• While many platforms charge separately for each channel, Google CES provides native omnichannel support across 100+ languages for voice, chat, SMS, WhatsApp, and email in a single design—eliminating duplicate bot builds and add-on fees that typical stacks impose.

• Traditional CX-AI solutions often create "black-box" experiences, but Google's hybrid architecture combines Dialogflow CX's rule-based guardrails with Gemini's natural language processing, delivering measurable outcomes like Marks & Spencer's 50% call deflection achieved in just 60 days.
customer engagement suite.objection handling:
**Modular purchase, open formats, and portability**

• Google CES provides exportable agent assets in standard JSON format with open REST/gRPC APIs, ensuring your conversational AI investments remain portable and customizable as your business grows

• Modular architecture allows you to start with specific use cases like order status inquiries or product availability checks, then expand to additional channels and locations at your own pace

• Pay-per-use pricing model aligns costs with actual usage across your 320+ facilities, avoiding large upfront commitments while maintaining full control over your customer experience technology stack

**Deployment speed and required effort**

• Pre-built connectors and templates for building materials industry use cases enable rapid deployment of virtual agents for common inquiries like product availability, delivery tracking, and store locations

• One-click integrations with existing systems minimize IT overhead, allowing your lean technology team to focus on core business operations rather than complex system integrations

• Elastic autoscaling ensures new facilities and seasonal demand spikes are handled automatically without manual infrastructure management or service disruptions

**Global language & omnichannel scalability**

• Dialogflow CX supports 100+ languages with voice and chat capabilities, enabling consistent customer service across all markets as you expand into new regions like your planned western US growth

• Omnichannel architecture seamlessly handles phone, web chat, and mobile interactions, ensuring customers can reach you through their preferred channel whether they're on a job site or at home planning projects

• Auto-scaling infrastructure accommodates peak periods like spring building season and promotional events without performance degradation or additional capacity planning

**Integrations and coexistence with existing telephony / CCaaS / CRM stack**

• One-click connectors for Salesforce CRM and pre-built integrations with telephony providers ensure customer conversation data flows directly into your existing systems without custom development

• Agent Assist integrates with your current contact center infrastructure, providing real-time guidance to representatives handling complex product inquiries and contractor accounts

• API-first architecture enables integration with your Oracle NetSuite ERP system for real-time inventory checks and order management across all 320+ locations

**Security, data sovereignty, and regulatory compliance**

• Customer data remains within your own GCP project with CMEK encryption and VPC Service Controls, ensuring complete data sovereignty while meeting enterprise security requirements

• Built-in compliance frameworks for PCI-DSS support secure payment discussions, while Access Transparency provides full visibility into any Google support interactions with your systems

• Zero-trust architecture and enterprise-grade security controls protect sensitive business information like contractor pricing, commercial accounts, and supply chain data

**Pricing model and demonstrated ROI**

• Elastic pay-per-use pricing scales with your actual customer interactions, avoiding fixed costs during slower periods while automatically handling peak building season demand

• Agent Assist delivers 30-45% average handle time reduction, enabling your customer service team to handle more inquiries about product availability, delivery schedules, and technical specifications

• Proven enterprise ROI with companies like Bell Canada achieving $20M quarterly savings at scale, demonstrating clear financial benefits for large-scale customer service operations

**Hybrid deterministic + generative design for controllability versus "black-box" LLM bots**

• Hybrid architecture combines deterministic rule-based logic for critical information like product specifications and safety data with generative AI for natural conversation flow

• Controllable AI responses ensure accurate product information, compliance with building codes, and consistent pricing across all customer touchpoints and geographic markets

• Transparent decision-making process allows your team to understand and refine how the system handles complex building material inquiries, contractor specifications, and regulatory compliance questions
